alert.note: Alert for Alachua; Columbia (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 12 at 9:09AM EST until further notice by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Jacksonville FL has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Florida... Santa Fe River near High Springs affecting Alachua and Columbia Counties. Additional information is available at https://water.weather.gov/ahps2/forecasts.php?wfo=jax. && ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM LATE MONDAY NIGHT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Santa Fe River near High Springs. * WHEN...From late Monday night until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 33.0 feet, High water will begin to impact docks and boat ramps in the area. At 34.2 feet, Florida Fish and Wildlife Commission begins enforcement of a no wake zone on the Santa Fe River from the River Rise in O`Leno State Park downstream to the center line of the US 27 Bridge. At 35.0 feet, Wooded areas along the river begin to flood. The boat ramp south of US-441 in Alachua County is inaccessible above this level. At 37.0 feet, Water begins to approach two residences along the river at the end of Southeast Resort Circle in Columbia County. The boat ramp near the US-27 bridge in Columbia County begins to flood at this level. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 AM EST Saturday the stage was 32.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early Tuesday morning and continue rising to a crest of 35.5 feet early Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 35.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
